segment.source: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.
segment.target: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.

segment.source: Identify input devices
segment.target: Identify input devices

segment.source: Identify input devices
segment.target: Identify input devices

segment.source: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.
segment.target: Identify the input devices connected to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) device and identify their capabilities and attributes.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: Windows.Devices.Input
segment.target: Windows.Devices.Input

segment.source: Windows.UI.Input
segment.target: Windows.UI.Input

segment.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input
segment.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input

segment.source: Retrieve mouse properties
segment.target: Retrieve mouse properties

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the MouseCapabilities class used to retrieve the properties exposed by one or more connected mice.
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the MouseCapabilities class used to retrieve the properties exposed by one or more connected mice.

segment.source: Just create a new MouseCapabilities object and get the properties you're interested in.
segment.target: Just create a new MouseCapabilities object and get the properties you're interested in.

segment.source: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected mice: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one mouse supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one mouse.
segment.target: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected mice: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one mouse supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one mouse.

segment.source: The following code uses a series of TextBlock elements to display the individual mouse properties and values.
segment.target: The following code uses a series of TextBlock elements to display the individual mouse properties and values.

segment.source: Retrieve keyboard properties
segment.target: Retrieve keyboard properties

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the KeyboardCapabilities class used to retrieve whether a keyboard is connected.
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the KeyboardCapabilities class used to retrieve whether a keyboard is connected.

segment.source: Just create a new KeyboardCapabilities object and get the KeyboardPresent property.
segment.target: Just create a new KeyboardCapabilities object and get the KeyboardPresent property.

segment.source: The following code uses a TextBlock element to display the keyboard property and value.
segment.target: The following code uses a TextBlock element to display the keyboard property and value.

segment.source: Retrieve touch properties
segment.target: Retrieve touch properties

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the TouchCapabilities class used to retrieve whether any touch digitizers are connected.
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the TouchCapabilities class used to retrieve whether any touch digitizers are connected.

segment.source: Just create a new TouchCapabilities object and get the properties you're interested in.
segment.target: Just create a new TouchCapabilities object and get the properties you're interested in.

segment.source: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected touch digitizers: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one digitizer supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one digitizer.
segment.target: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected touch digitizers: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one digitizer supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one digitizer.

segment.source: The following code uses a series of TextBlock elements to display the touch properties and values.
segment.target: The following code uses a series of TextBlock elements to display the touch properties and values.

segment.source: Retrieve pointer properties
segment.target: Retrieve pointer properties

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the PointerDevice class used to retrieve whether any detected devices support pointer input (touch, touchpad, mouse, or pen).
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Input namespace contains the PointerDevice class used to retrieve whether any detected devices support pointer input (touch, touchpad, mouse, or pen).

segment.source: Just create a new PointerDevice object and get the properties you're interested in.
segment.target: Just create a new PointerDevice object and get the properties you're interested in.

segment.source: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected pointer devices: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one device supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one pointer device.
segment.target: Note The values returned by the properties discussed here are based on all detected pointer devices: Boolean properties return non-zero if at least one device supports a specific capability, and numeric properties return the maximum value exposed by any one pointer device.

segment.source: The following code uses a table to display the properties and values for each pointer device.
segment.target: The following code uses a table to display the properties and values for each pointer device.
